{{DISPLAYTITLE:archivemount}} {{Infobox software | name = archivemount | title = archivemount | logo = <!-- [[File: ]] --> | screenshot = <!-- [[File: ]] --> | caption = | collapsible = | author = | developer = | released = <!-- {{Start date|YYYY|MM|DD|df=yes/no}} --> | discontinued = | latest release version = 0.6.1 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2010|06|24|df=yes/no}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = <!-- {{Start date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|df=yes/no}} --> | frequently updated = <!-- DO NOT include this parameter unless you know what it does --> | programming language = [[C (programming language)|C]] | operating system = [[Unix-like]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = | genre = [[Special file system]] | license = [[GNU Lesser General Public License|LGPL]] | website = {{URL|http://www.cybernoia.de/software/archivemount/}} }} '''archivemount''' is a [[Filesystem in Userspace|FUSE]]-based file system for Unix variants, including Linux. Its purpose is to [[Mount (computing)|mount]] archives (i.e. [[tar (file format)|tar]], tar.gz, etc.) to a mount point where it can be read from or written to as with any other file system. This makes accessing the contents of the archive, which may be compressed, transparent to other programs, without decompressing them.
==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[CompFUSEd]] * [[GVFS]]
==External links== * http://www.cybernoia.de/software/archivemount/ * http://apps.sourceforge.net/mediawiki/fuse/index.php?title=ArchiveFileSystems * http://www.linux.com/feature/132196
{{compu-prog-stub}}
